text:
01 of 15 Steve Granitz/WireImage "I'm second to the dog. I'm kind of a Malcom in the Middle type child." — Saoirse Ronan, joking about how her mom prefers her dog over Saoirse, on ABC's Red Carpet Show

02 of 15 "We're really good sisters." "We're really good drinkers, too." — Nicole Kidman and Sandra Bullock, describing herself and Practical Magic costar Nicole Kidman, on ABC's Red Carpet Show

03 of 15 Kevin Mazur/WireImage "He said, 'You owe me money!'" — Chadwick Boseman, on thanking Denzel Washington for paying for his Oxford theater program, on ABC's Red Carpet Show

04 of 15 David Fisher/Shutterstock "If it would be up to me, it would be in the garage to keep me humble." — Viola Davis, joking about keeping her Oscar in her office, on ABC's Red Carpet Show

05 of 15 Frazer Harrison/Getty "She wears me out and puts me in my place in her own way, but I absolutely love her and that’s my heart." — Mahershala Ali, opening up about his daughter, on ABC's Red Carpet Show

06 of 15 Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP/Shutterstock "It's been hanging in my closet and I go and stroke it now and then. I just love — it was an amazing night. They didn't have a red carpet then, it was so different." — Rita Moreno, on why she's wearing the same dress she wore at the 1962 Oscars, on the People & Entertainment Weekly Red Carpet Live

07 of 15 David Fisher/Shutterstock "He said one day I would end up here and if I ever ended up at the Oscars to honor my people so I’m honoring my fellow Eritreans!" — Tiffany Haddish, on choosing her outfit to honor her late dad who was Eritrean, on ABC's Red Carpet Show

08 of 15 Richard Shotwell/Invision/AP/Shutterstock "I think I'm gonna try and cool it on the tears this time." — Kelly Marie Tran, on refraining from crying at the Oscars, on ABC's Red Carpet Show

09 of 15 Steve Granitz/WireImage "I'm out of my comfort zone. The Oscars are such a big deal. I’m trying to soak it all in and not mess it up." — Lindsey Vonn, on why she thinks the Oscars are a bigger deal than the Olympics, on the People & Entertainment Weekly Red Carpet Live

10 of 15 Dan MacMedan-USA TODAY NETWORK/Sipa "She'd be gone. She would have left. That would have been the difference." — Kumail Nanjiani, joking that things would have turned out differently if he was in a coma instead of wife Emily V. Gordon, on the People and Entertainment Weekly Red Carpet Live

11 of 15 Frazer Harrison/Getty "If you're meant to do this, you will find a way." — Richard Jenkins, on his advice for aspiring actors, on ABC's Red Carpet Show

12 of 15 Frazer Harrison/Getty "… I would die. They can leave my body on the red carpet." —Adam Rippon, on what would happen if he met Meryl Streep at the Oscars, on the People & Entertainment Weekly Red Carpet Live

13 of 15 Chelsea Lauren/Shutterstock "Mark came in time for 12 hours and this is how we are spending it." — Kelly Ripa, on how she and husband Mark Consuelos are spending their Sunday night, on E! Live from the Red Carpet

14 of 15 Jeff Kravitz/FilmMagic "If they called me I could have out on a blond wig and done a triple axel for them, but I’ll be around for the sequel." — Mirai Nagasu, joking about having been able to help in I, Tonya, on People & Entertainment Weekly Red Carpet Live
authors: Grace Gavilanes Is A Former Associate Editor At People. She Left People In
title: 'I'm Trying to Soak It All In': The Best Quotes from the Oscars Red Carpet

meta_data.description: See what the stars are saying
